titleStmt.title: Grant by Nicholas Thorne to the Mayor and commonality of Bristol of St Bartholomews

msContents.p: This is where an abstract will go?

div.p:
To all trewe xpen christian people to whom this present writinge
shall come. Nicholas Thorne of the Citie of Bristowe merchaunt
brother and heire of the Robert Thorne late of the Citie aforesaid decessed
son and heire of Nicholas Thorne late Alderman of the same Citie
decessed brother and heire of Robert Thorne late of London merchaunt
decessed sende greating. Where the late prince of famouse memory king
Henry the eight for and in consideracion of the lawdable purpose of Sir
Thomas West knight Lorde La warre George Crofte clerk the said
Robert Thorne of London merchaunt, Nicholas Thorne Alderman of the said
Citie of Bristowe amd John Godriche clerk executors of the testament of
Robert Thorne sometyme of Bristowe merchaunt decessed father of the said
Robert and Nicholas in the ereccion fundacion contynuannce and surpportacion
of a perpetuall ffree schole of grammer of one schole master and one or two
ushers to be established wtin within the Citie or towne of Bristowe and lymyttes
of the same, by his lettres patentes bering date at ChelschethChelsea. the seven
tyneth daie of Marche in the three and Twentyth yere of his raigne
did give and graunte lycense or hym his heires and successors to the
maior maior burgeises and comminaltie of the said Towne of Bristowe and to their
Successors, that they and their successors mought at any tyme thereafter
purchase receave and take to them and to their successors the house and
hospitall of the Bartilmewes in Bristol aforesaid / And all manners landes
mesuages tenementes gardens orchardes medesmeadow lesuesleasow, i.e. pasture or meadow pastures wood rentes
revercions and services and hereditamentes wthwith all their their rightes profittes and
comodities that then or at any tyme before were accepted reputed or
taken as parcell or membre of the possessions of the said hospitall or
that George Crofte then Master of the said hospitall had helde or did
enioy in the right of the saide hospitall, aswell wthinwithin the said towne of
Bristowe and suburbs of the same, as in the parishes of Clyfton stapulton
Sodbury and wickwarre in the Countie of gloucester or wthinwithin the countie of
the towne of Bristowe and the countie of gloucester or elles where wthinwithin the
realme of englonde / to the clere yerely value of ffourtie poundes over
and above all charges, aswell of the said Sir Thomas West knight late
Lorde La warre patron and founder of the said hospitall, as of the
said George Crofte Clerk master of the said house and hospitall and
the brothers and sisters of the same or of any other person or persons
having or pretending any right or title to the premisses, though they wer
holden of the said late king his heires and successors in chief or otherwise ./
To have to the said Maior Maior burgeises and commynaltie and to their successors successors
for ever to the uses and intentes aforesaid / And further by the same did
graunt his speciall license to the same persons that they mought give the
said house or hospitall maners landes tenementes and hereditamentes and
other the premisses unto the Maior Maior burgeises and commynaltie of Bristowe
aforesaid and to their successors for ever, as by the same lettres patentes it
maie appere /. And where also in the terme of Ester in the xxiijto xxiijto
and xxiiijth xxiiijth yeres of the raigne of the same late kinge Henry the eight
The said Robert Thorne of London merchaunt Nicholas Thorne of Bristowe his
brother and John Godriche clerk by two severall writtes of entre in the past
by them brought did recover against the said George Crofte clerk then
master of the house or hospitall of sainte Bartilmews in Brostowe and sir
Thomas Weste knight Lorde La warre decessed then patron or founder of the
said hospitall, the said house or hospitall of the Bartilmewes, sixe messuages
three hundred acres of lande, foure skore acres of mede, two hundred acres of
pasture, tenne acres of wudd, and ffourtie shillinges of rente wth with
thapprtenancꝭ thappertenances
in kynesmarshe, and in the parisshes of Clifton wickwarre Stapulton Over
horfilde and Sodbury in the Countie of Gloucester. And ffourtie messuages, thirtie
gardens, tenne acres of land six acres of mede, twenty acres of pastures and
ffourtie shillinges of rent wth with
thapprtenancꝭ thappertenances in the towne of Bristowe and in
the parishes of saint Augustynes, saint Mighell, saint James and saint Philup
in the subburbes of the saide towne of Bristow as by the tenor tenor of the said two
severall recoveries exemplified under the seale of the Court of the common
plees at westminster of the said terme of Ester more playnely it may appere /
By vertue of whiche recovery the said Robert Thorne of London Nicholas his
brother and John Godriche clerk did entre into the premisses and were thereof
seased in their demeane as of ffee to the uses and ententes that they, their
heires or assignes shulde geve the same premisses specified in the said recovery
to the Maior burgeises and commmynaltie of Bristowe and to their successours
for ever to and for the erection establisshement and contynuannce of a free grammer
schole to be erected
wthin within the said howse of the Bartilmews, and to establishe there one
schole master and one or two usshers for the same / And where after
such recoverie and entrie by them made into the premisses, the said Robert
Thorne of London and the said John Godriche clerk did thereof seased
and the said Nicholas overlived, and was sole seased of the premisses
in his demeane as of fee by title survivor survivor and so being seased did
make a grammer schole wtin within the said howse of the Bartilmews and did
place and sett one John Harris Schole master to the teche grammer
wthin within the
same And after before any further assuruance or establishment thereof
made the said Nicholas Thorne died, and the premisses discened to the
said Robert as sonne and heire of the said Nicholas Thorne whiche
Robert before any estate executed died wthowt withowt issue, by reason whereof
the premisse discended unto me the said Nicholas as brother and nexte
heire to the said Robert, and also to the said Nicholasmy father / Ye
shall knowe me the said Nicholas Thorne by vertue of the said
lettres patentes in thaccomplishement aswell of the good prpose purpose and will
of the said Robert my uncle and the said Nicholas my father, as also
for thestablishement and perpetuall contynuaunce of a free schole to be
created wthin within the saide house of the Bartilmews of one schole master
and one or two usshers as nede and occasion hereafter shall serve to teche
and bring upp yowth and others in lerning and virtue and specially in
grammer and other good littaratures for the better educacion and bringing
uppe of Children and others that will resorte thither for lerning of grammer
and understanding of the tonges to the honor honor of god and advauncement
of the said citie to have geven graunted and confirmed and by this
my present dede doe give graunt and confirme unto the Maior Maior burgeises and
comynaltie of the Citie of Bristowe aforesaid, and to their successors forever the said
late house or hospitall called the Bartilmewes scituate in Bristowe aforesaid,
wth with all houses edifices and buyldinges thereunto belonging or in any wise appertey
ning / And all mesuages gardens orchades landes tenementes medowes pastures
revercions services and rentes
wth with in the countie of the said citie of Bristoll, and
all other manners mesuages landes Tenementes medowes pastures woodes underwoodes
rentes revercions and services, and all other hereditmentes in Kyngesmarche and wthin within
the parisshes of Clifton Wikewarr Sodbury and Elshere wthin within the Countie
of gloucester specified wthin within the said two severall recoveries sometyme parcell of the
possessions of the said late hospitall, in as large and ample manner as the
same came of right ought to come to the handes and possession of the
said Robert Thorne my uncle and to the said Nicholas Thorne my
father and to the said John Goodriche clerk or any of them by vertue of
the said two severall recoveries and license aforesaid /. To have holde
and enioye the premisses to the said Maior Maior burgeisses and commynaltie of the
said citie of Bristowe and to their successors forever to the uses and intentes
of the fynding of a free grammer schole wthin within the said howse called the
Bartilmewes for ever. And to fynde one sufficient and able person being
sufficiently lerned and vertuouse to be schole master there, and one or two
other sufficiente person or persons being also sufficientlie lerned and vertuouse
to be usher or ushers there. And they the said masters and usher or ushers
and their successors contynually to teache grammer
wthin within the said schole to all
childrene and other that will repaire to the said schole for lerning and
knowledge of the laten tonge and other good lerning for the better education
and bringing upp of yowthe in lerning and vertue. And that frelie wthout without
any thinge to be taken, other than fowre pence onlie for the firste admission
of every scholer into the same Schole / To holde the premisses of the
chief lordes of the fee by the service thereof due and accustomed /. And
I the said Nicholas Thorne and my heirs all and singuler the premisses
againste me and my heires to the said Maior Maior burgeises and commynaltie
and to their successors as aforesaid shall warraunt acquitt and defende by
theis presentes / And farther ye shall knowe that by theis presentes I the said
Nicholas Thorne have deputed assigned and in my place have constituted
my beloved Thomas Kelke and John Cutt merchauntes my laufull
attorneis iointlie and severallie for me and in my name to enter into the premisses
and thereof to take possession and season and thereof for me and in my
name to delier season and possession to the said Maior Maior burgeises and comminaltie
or to their sufficient attorney in their name or behalf according to the tenor tenor
effecte and true meaninge of this my present dede. Ratifienge and confirmyng
all and every thinge that my said attorneis or either of them shall doo
the premisses. In witnes whereof I the said Nicholas Thorne have to
thies presentes putt my seal yoven the fuste day of Julie, in the yere of or our
lorde god a thowsand five hundred three skore and one / and in the thrydde
yere of the raigne of or our
soveraigne ladie Elizabeth by the grace of god of
Englond ffraunce and Irelond Quene defendor defendor of the faieth

Sealed and delivered in the presence of David Harris William Pepwall & and
Roberte Saxy
Aldremen of the citie of Bristoll / Michaell Sowdley one of the sharives of the
same, John Warren Roger Walker swordberer of the same citie John Edwardes
Richard Marshall and John Die the writer if these presentes, the daie & and yere aforesaide

Md that the daie & and and yere wtin within written full & and peasable possession & and season of the howse or
late hospitall called the Bartilmewes wtin within
mentioned
wt with
thappurtenances was taken & and
delivered by Thomas Kelke one of the attorneis wtin within named to Thomas Slapman merchaunt
& and
Thomas Hickes chamberlain attorneis of the wtin within named Maior Maior burgeises and comminaltie
according to the tenor tenor and effort of this presente dede in the present of Henry Elmley
John Drouson Thomas Withwell, Thomas England Henry Marton William Edwardes
Edward Carr, William Wynter george Suly Josias Hatton, Edward Chester
Wt with Kelke, Miles Dewson Edward Walse and others ?? &c etc
